alert.note: Alert for Logan; Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 09 at 7:08PM CDT until June 09 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL YELL AND SOUTH CENTRAL LOGAN COUNTIES... At 708 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the past 1 to 2 hours...from Blue Mountain Dam...to Havana...to Belleville. While the heavy rainfall has recently ended...it may take some time for this water to run off. As a result...flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Danville, Magazine, Blue Mountain, Stonehouse Recreation Area, Belleville, Havana, Corinth, Waveland, Waltreak, Macedonia in Yell County, Spring Lake Campground and Sugar Grove. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
